message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze the relationship between infrastructure and economic growth by utilizing panel data on road, railway, and air transport infrastructure across 59 countries in Sub-Saharan Africa from 2001-2014.", "dataset": ["panel data on road, railway, and air transport infrastructure"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "The study uses a unique farm-level data collected in six major maize-producing states in India between 2013 and 2017 to investigate yield gaps, sources of inefficiency, and potential for improvement in maize production.", "dataset": ["unique farm-level data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This paper evaluates the impact of multiple stressors like heat waves, droughts, and floods on rice yields in Bangladesh and Vietnam using high-resolution satellite data from Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) and estimates from crop simulation model AquaCrop.", "dataset": ["high-resolution satellite data from Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis is based on multiple waves of household surveys, including the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA), and the Nigeria General Household Survey Panel (NGHSP) from 2010 to 2019, combined with complementary data on weather conditions from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station (CHIRPS).", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)", "Nigeria General Household Survey Panel (NGHSP)", "Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station (CHIRPS)"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "The article uses time-series data from National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) for multiple weather variables and malaria incidence data from the Health Management Information System (HMIS) to examine the impact of climate variability on malaria in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)", "Health Management Information System (HMIS)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset that bridges administrative records from the Electricity Distribution Companies (DisCos) with consumer-level survey data collected by GeoPoll across eight Sub-Saharan African countries to analyze electricity access, reliability, affordability, and willingness-to-pay among urban and peri-urban low-income households.", "dataset": ["administrative records from the Electricity Distribution Companies (DisCos)", "consumer-level survey data collected by GeoPoll"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "The study combines new high-resolution poverty maps constructed using machine learning methods based on nighttime lights data with household survey data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to examine subnational variation in poverty and inequality across Africa.", "dataset": ["machine learning methods based on nighttime lights data", "Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Survey combined with hand-collected tariff line information, we document a strong heterogeneity in the incidence of non-tariff measures (NTMs) across firms and sectors in Egypt, Jordan, Morocco, and Tunisia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Trade", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "The paper relies on a dataset that spans 307 cities in 64 countries and covers over 900 metropolitan areas, combining various alternative sources of data like Open Street Map, DigitalGlobe, TomTom, and the European Space Agency's Climate Change Initiative (CCI) dataset.", "dataset": ["Open Street Map", "DigitalGlobe", "TomTom", "European Space Agency's Climate Change Initiative (CCI) dataset"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use a dataset covering 34 African countries from the International Telecommunications Union (ITU) combined with additional complementary datasets on infrastructure provided by the World Bank and Afrobarometer to investigate the determinants of internet penetration and usage in Africa.", "dataset": ["International Telecommunications Union (ITU)", "World Bank", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on firm-level data on wages, employment, and productivity collected through the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the nationally representative Labor Force Surveys (LFS) in Ghana, Mozambique, Senegal, Tanzania, and Uganda to investigate gender gaps in labor market outcomes and their relationship with firm characteristics.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Labor Force Surveys (LFS)"], "topic": ["Gender"]}]
